intro: Hedyotis densa, commonly known as the dense hedyotis, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant features small, opposite, ovate leaves that are usually covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are tiny, white or pale yellow, and clustered in dense inflorescences. Hedyotis densa is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or along stream banks.
